rules.natural: If drug X requires a black box warning, then drug X requires a warning label.
Either drug X receives fast track approval, or if the absence of mild side effects does not imply drug X is safe for use, then drug X requires a black box warning.
Provided that phase 1 for drug X is complete, drug X is safe for use.
Whenever phase 2 for drug X is complete, drug X is safe for use.
If animal testing for drug X is complete, then phase 1 for drug X is complete.
In the event that preliminary human trials for drug X are complete, phase 2 for drug X is complete.
Should a safety profile for drug X be established, then either animal testing for drug X is complete or preliminary human trials for drug X are complete.
Assuming efficacy of drug X is demonstrated, then either animal testing for drug X is complete or preliminary human trials for drug X are complete.
Drug X is withdrawn from the market, or a safety profile for drug X is established, or efficacy of drug X is demonstrated.
Either drug X is rejected, or drug X is pending review.
Drug X is voluntarily recalled, or it is not the case that drug X is withdrawn from the market.
Provided that drug X has a regulatory violation, a fine is imposed on drug X.
Whenever drug X has a regulatory violation, criminal charges are filed for drug X.
Drug X has a regulatory violation, or if drug X is rejected, then it is not the case that drug X is approved.
Should the license for drug X be suspended, then it is not the case that a fine is imposed on drug X.
If criminal charges are filed for drug X, then the license for drug X is suspended.
Assuming drug X is patent protected, then it is not the case that drug X is approved.
Provided that drug X has exclusive marketing rights, then it is not the case that a generic version of drug X is available.
If the patent for drug X has expired, then if it is not the case that drug X is patent protected, drug X has exclusive marketing rights.
In the event that the patent for drug X is challenged, then if it is not the case that drug X is patent protected, drug X has exclusive marketing rights.
Should drug X be pending review, then it is not the case that drug X is approved.
If a generic application for drug X is submitted, then the patent for drug X has expired.
Provided that a biosimilar application for drug X is submitted, then the patent for drug X is challenged.
Whenever the price of drug X is reduced, competitive market entry occurs for drug X.
The price of drug X is reduced, or drug X experiences market share loss.
Drug X has orphan drug status, or it is not the case that drug X requires a clinical trial.
If drug X has a rare disease indication, then it is not the case that drug X has orphan drug status.
Either drug X has a rare disease indication, or drug X addresses an unmet medical need.
In case drug X addresses an unmet medical need, then it is not the case that drug X has orphan drug status.
Provided that drug X requires monitoring, then drug X is safe for use.
Should drug X be under post-market surveillance, then if drug X has mild side effects, drug X requires monitoring.
Drug X is under post-market surveillance, or drug X has a risk management program.
Assuming adverse event reporting is conducted for drug X, then if the absence of mild side effects does not imply drug X is safe for use, drug X requires a warning label.
Adverse event reporting is conducted for drug X, or a patient registry exists for drug X.
Either an audit is scheduled for drug X, or an inspection is required for drug X.

Whenever an inspection is required for drug X, then if it is not the case that a patient registry exists for drug X implies that if the absence of mild side effects does not imply drug X is safe for use, then drug X requires a warning label, then drug X has a data integrity issue.

(A11 → A10).natural: If drug X requires a black box warning, then drug X requires a warning label.

(A12 ∨ (¬(A9 → G) → A11)).natural: Either drug X receives fast track approval, or if the absence of mild side effects does not imply drug X is safe for use, then drug X requires a black box warning.

(A13 → G).natural: Provided that phase 1 for drug X is complete, drug X is safe for use.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either phase 1 for drug X is complete, or phase 2 for drug X is complete.

(A14 → G).natural: Whenever phase 2 for drug X is complete, drug X is safe for use.

(A15 → A13).natural: If animal testing for drug X is complete, then phase 1 for drug X is complete.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: Animal testing for drug X is complete, or preliminary human trials for drug X are complete.

(A16 → A14).natural: In the event that preliminary human trials for drug X are complete, phase 2 for drug X is complete.

(A17 → (A15 ∨ A16)).natural: Should a safety profile for drug X be established, then either animal testing for drug X is complete or preliminary human trials for drug X are complete.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: A safety profile for drug X is established, or efficacy of drug X is demonstrated.

(A18 → (A15 ∨ A16)).natural: Assuming efficacy of drug X is demonstrated, then either animal testing for drug X is complete or preliminary human trials for drug X are complete.

(A19 ∨ (A17 ∨ A18)).natural: Drug X is withdrawn from the market, or a safety profile for drug X is established, or efficacy of drug X is demonstrated.

(A2 → ¬A1).natural: If drug X is rejected, then it is not the case that drug X is approved.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: Either drug X is rejected, or drug X is pending review.

(A20 ∨ ¬A19).natural: Drug X is voluntarily recalled, or it is not the case that drug X is withdrawn from the market.

(A21 → A22).natural: Provided that drug X has a regulatory violation, a fine is imposed on drug X.

(A21 → A23).natural: If drug X has a regulatory violation, then the license for drug X is suspended.

(A21 → A24).natural: Whenever drug X has a regulatory violation, criminal charges are filed for drug X.

(A21 → ¬A22).natural: In case drug X has a regulatory violation, then it is not the case that a fine is imposed on drug X.
